Text: Look, I'm not gonna defend or support this movement at all, because I really don't. And I'm definitely not saying that what they are doing is acceptable, but technically speaking, what they're doing or saying is not *PER SE* racist, because they have a problem with a certain religion, in this case Islam, not with a certain race*. (For example, anyone could become a christian, muslim, hindu or whatever, regardless of their ethnicity, skin color or "race".) They're what people would call "Islamophobic". And while Islamophobia or hate towards any other religion might not be the same as actual racism, that certainly doesn't necessarily mean that it's more or less acceptable than actual racism. So I'm absolutely not saying that because it ain't racist, it suddenly becomes more acceptable. They're just not the same thing. You could compare it with Homophobia, which of course, isn't racism, but it's definitely not more acceptable that racism because of that. They're all different forms of *discrimination* is what would be the most general and correct way to say it. And again, I do not support any of these forms/types of discrimination, this comment is just about the question of using the right term for the right thing.  Also, note that I'm saying "PER SE", because it's still possible that they're actual racists, but just not because of that reason.  (*Which actually already doesn't exist at all, because there's only one race and that's the human race. We're all people and we're all equal, so we should definitely stop dividing ourselves into "races" or whatever that don't actually exist, and start treating each other as equal "fellow humans" instead labelling people into boxes for whatever reason.)
Author: Michelleken

Text:
@AnarchoGoonerQuran 47:4 is another misreprented one like all others.

War means violence. No one goes to battle field to kiss the enemy. Then why was it necessary for God to describe what to do in battlefield so vividly in this verse??

when you encounter the unbelievers [in battle], strike at their necks. Then, once they are defeated, bind them firmly. Then either release them by grace, or by ransom, until the war is over. (Quran 47:4)
The above 👆 verse is the prohibition that Muslims cannot take anyone as slave other than whom they have very strenuously battled and defeated. That means, they can't capture innocent non-battling man, woman, children. In history, most slaves were taken by capturing them from their village when they were living their regular life. The following verse of the Quran permits taking slave only when someone starts war with Muslim and Muslims win the defensive war. But that is the last option. The first choice is to release them through grace or ransome them with Muslim captives, as the verse says.

IT DOES NOT behove a prophet to keep captives unless he has battled strenuously on earth. You may desire the fleeting gains of this world - but God desires [for you the good of] the life to come: and God is almighty, wise. (Quran 8:67)
The captive/slave were also treated much differently than western definition of slavery. Freeing slave was one of the highest good deed (90:13, 4:92, 58:3). The captives/slaves must be provided with food (76:8). They were allowed to marry and live family life ( 24:32, 4:25, 2:221). And if a slave wanted freedom, the master had to promise his freedom in writing that he would get it after saving enough money to buy it (24:33).
Author: Mythical Umut

Text:
@AnarchoGoonerSurah 9:123 

O believers! Fight the disbelievers around you and let them find firmness in you. And know that Allah is with those mindful ˹of Him˺.

9:124

Whenever a sûrah is revealed, some of them ask ˹mockingly˺, “Which of you has this increased in faith?” As for the believers, it has increased them in faith and they rejoice.

But look at 9:122

˹However,˺ it is not necessary for the believers to march forth all at once. Only a party from each group should march forth, leaving the rest to gain religious knowledge then enlighten their people when they return to them, so that they ˹too˺ may beware ˹of evil˺.

This ayah tells you to fight and kill the transgessors and oppressors.
Author: Mythical Umut

Text:
@AnarchoGooner9:5 is a common one misrepresented. Bear with me.

This verse from Surah Taubah is very often quoted by critics of Islam, to show that Islam promotes violence, bloodshed and brutality:

“Kill the mushriqeen (pagans, polytheists, kuffar) where ever you find them.” [Al-Qur’an 9:5]


1. Context of verse is during battlefield

Critics of Islam actually quote this verse out of context. In order to understand the context, we need to read from verse 1 of this surah. It says that there was a peace treaty between the Muslims and the Mushriks (pagans) of Makkah. This treaty was violated by the Mushriks of Makkah. A period of four months was given to the Mushriks of Makkah to make amends. Otherwise war would be declared against them. Verse 5 of Surah Taubah says:

“But when the forbidden months are past, then fight and slay the Pagans wherever ye find them, and seize them, beleaguer them, and lie in wait for them in every stratagem (of war); but if they repent, and establish regular prayers and practice regular charity, then open the way for them: for Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.” [Al-Qur’an 9:5]

This verse is quoted during a battle.


2. Example of war between America and Vietnam

We know that America was once at war with Vietnam. Suppose the President of America or the General of the American Army told the American soldiers during the war: “Wherever you find the Vietnamese, kill them”. Today if I say that the American President said, “Wherever you find the Vietnamese, kill them” without giving the context, I will make him sound like a butcher. But if I quote him in context, that he said it during a war, it will sound very logical, as he was trying to boost the morale of the American soldiers during the war.


3. Verse 9:5 quoted to boost morale of Muslims during battle

Similarly in Surah Taubah chapter 9 verse 5 the Qur’an says, “Kill the Mushriks wherever you find them”, during a battle to boost the morale of the Muslim soldiers. What the Qur’an is telling Muslim soldiers is, don’t be afraid during battle; wherever you find the enemies kill them.

“If one amongst the pagans ask thee for asylum, grant it to him, so that he may hear the word of Allah; and then escort him to where he can be secure that is because they are men without knowledge.” [Al-Qur’an 9:6]

The Qur’an not only says that a Mushrik seeking asylum during the battle should be granted refuge, but also that he should be escorted to a secure place. In the present international scenario, even a kind, peace-loving army General, during a battle, may let the enemy soldiers go free, if they want peace. But which army General will ever tell his soldiers, that if the enemy soldiers want peace during a battle, don’t just let them go free, but also escort them to a place of security?


This is exactly what Allah (swt) says in the Glorious Qur’an to promote peace in the world.
Author: Mythical Umut

Text:

8:66

Now Allah has lightened your burden, for He knows that there is weakness in you. So if there are a hundred steadfast among you, they will overcome two hundred. And if there be one thousand, they will overcome two thousand, by Allah’s Will. And Allah is with the steadfast.

This surah gives us hope, strength and motivation. Again, ignorance.

Text: I'm sorry to say this but what you are doing by taking the piss out of already angry and frustrated working class people is creating more racism. I know it's funny af and we can all have a laugh about people who are naive and gullible but at the end of the day, these people are going to go home and remember that it was a black bloke who set them up. That's all they will remember. Not that he was taking the piss out of them and what tricks he used to make them look stupid but that his skin was a darker shade than theirs. You're setting yourself up for disaster, mate. This stuff is the reason they don't trust the media and it's the reason why these echo chambers get more and more radicalized. By losing trust in everyone around them, they isolate themselves and stop talking to people who might not have the same opinion as them. We really need to learn to listen and actually understand where people are coming from to fight racism. This woman with the bad teeth clearly went through some sheet. Instead of trying to get cheap reactions from her, it might have been really interesting to get her story on camera. I think what you are doing is a really bad idea that will backfire big time for other black people and immigrants and society at large. You are not spreading more harmony with these videos but more discord. I hope you will realize this and maybe take a more documentarian approach, getting the stories from the people instead of telling their stories for them.
Author: Iruska Cape

Text: Hmm interesting, second video I've seen of yours and you are so full of it. You throw the word racist around a lot for no good reason. Some just said they were white, English, and proud. So what? That's not racist. If a black American is proud of themselves does that make them racist? No. What the concern here is, is that they want to preserve their race and culture as they feel it's under threat. So what? Again, not racist. Every other race and culture is the same. Do you think if whites or blacks mass migrated to let's say Japan, and the Japanese started to become the minorities, that they would have concerns? Of course they would. Any one would. They're not racist for raising these concerns and taking action to preserve their way of life.  Any race, in any country, would have some concern if others mass migrated and they themselves started to become minorities. You would have legitimate concern for your own race and culture, and understandably so. There are many countries worldwide where blacks, browns, or Asians, are the majority, and no one has a problem with that. As soon as you have a white majority country though and want to keep it that way, everyone says that's racist. Which seems to be more racist than anything. You don't want us having our own space as you have yours. White's are already the minority worldwide, and their birth rates are dropping. Japan's population is also decreasing. There is nothing wrong with trying to fix this. Limiting migration (not stopping it) is a logical part of the solution, and is not racist in the least bit.  You're throwing around the word racist when it doesn't accurately portray the situation at all, which is very common.
Author: Aza Z

Text:
​@Jésus 
That's the problem with people nowadays - any time anyone disagrees with anything this is often considered hate speech. Disagree with Islam or a Muslim and you are Islamophobic. Disagree with a trans person and you're transphobic. Disagree with the immigration policies and you are xenophobic, etc.

I get called an Islamophobe from time to time as well. Why? Because I question videos like these, and realize immigration can be a problem. Well good lord I suppose that makes me racist! You know, I dated a Muslim woman for 2 years. And of course any time anyone would argue with her she would overreact and call them an Islamophobe, even when the argument had nothing to do with Islam or Muslims to begin with. I had a black neighbour that would do the same. They'd pull the race card any time they got into any argument about anything at all that had nothing to do with race. People throw these words around any time they don't get their own way or someone disagrees with them.

Do you really think that this interviewer accurately portrayed the whole group, or did they instead pick out a few loudmouths and people with no teeth, so as to make the whole group look bad? This is exactly what both left and right wingers do. They go to some rally, pick out the obvious tools, interview them, and then misrepresent the whole group and the issues to be addressed. He even skipped over much of what was said and just told us it was racist drivel. Convenient. Well I guess I'll just have to take his word for it. Interesting he didn't sit down with anyone and actually have a proper debate over actual issues. That's not his job. His job is to just make everyone out to be a racist.
Author: Aza Z

Text:
@Jésus Islamophobia? Phobia of an ideology? I can understand minorities being a protected class but why religion? It's just an idea, you can change your religion unlike race(though in Islam you get killed for doing that, apostasy carries death penalty).

And islamic orthodoxy features a lot of illiberal ideas such as support of child marriage, slavery, anti women's/gay rights, arab(ic) supremacy, theocracy, imperialism, blasphemy, and shuns rational free thought that goes against the religion, excusing violent deadly punishment for such.

Note that I said islamic *orthodoxy*, as in what the beliefs of the religion are in it's purest form(from the sayings of the central book, the qur'an, and that of the prophet, the hadith) as interpreted by the prophet and his companions as well as the scholars closer to that time more equipped to interpret it. The only major distinction is between the four schools of thought, the madhabs, and the only matters on which there are significant difference of opinion between them are stuff like how muslims should pray whereas the things I said above are pretty much accepted by all four major schools.

Won't deny islam has some good charitable things in it as well, however muslims are required to believe *all* of it so accepting it for that also means condoning every single thing including the bad parts.
Author: Terabyte
Jésus

Text:
​@Jésus Is it racist to hate horrible cultural practices? Like some third world countries have child marriages, honor killings, FGM, etc. it may be in their "culture" but is it a bad thing to hate it? Surely, there are also people in those countries opposed to those practices even though they share the same "race", so how does that fit into that entire worldview?

Even if you say yes it is racist, for all of it, then perhaps racism shouldn't be a pejorative or bad thing in all applications because those are some cases where I'd say it is entirely just and correct.

Text: Funny vid and great concept but... I think this particular instance and that group is confusing nationalism with racism. All those people who talked to Niko 'from EDL TV' clearly didn't have any issue with him being black did they... that's race and racism, because they hear he is English/his accent. I'm not defending them, I think they're idiots; I'm just distinguishing between race and nationality.   That group seems to not like immigration / people from other countries... that's... nationalism/as there's obviously black people born in the UK/I know a lot of people refer to nationalism as pride in a nation, but this is where that inevitably leads with some people (idiots), like all forms of tribal thinking (nationalism, racism, sexism, football hooliganism and team sports support, >>RELIGION<<, gangs)... it's putting yourself in a group and that eventually becomes 'us vs. them' = 'them' being anybody outside of that perceived group. It's a toxic and stupid passover for all humans unfortunately, and it leads to pure stupidity and violence always.  Islam is also not a race lol, it's a religion. These people are idiots and prejudice but again, it's mislabelling things as racism, using one term for it all. It would be like calling sexists racists... get the word right lol.
Author: Nick Sully

Text: ''You like to dress up in women's clothing''. That in itself is offensive hate language. There is nothing wrong with a bit of cross dressing. Well done bringing yourself to their level. I thought I'd been transported back to 1970 for a minute.  ''I'm against Islam as an ideology''.. I'm fairly certain that is not racist. in fact anyone who chooses to live by truth and reason would have to agree and have issues with most all organised religions.  The guy who said it was surely a moron because of his association with that appalling EDL group, BUT the bit he actually managed to say was reasonable, not racist and hard to argue against. It would have been a lot more interesting to actually speak with the guy instead of making fart noises like a twat, esp. since what the guy said was the most intelligent sentence in the whole video. Then again I'm over 12 years old and have no idea what I'm doing here.
Author: Martin D A

Text:
​@Pranshu How Mughal rule created a WRETCHED India ?

The truth about India’s most painful chapter in its history

If I have to describe the life of an Indian in Mughal Raj in a single paragraph - This is how it was

The enormous burden of poverty that Indians carried pinioned them, like a worm impaled on a nail, helpless and immobile in their predicament—a poverty so oppressive and seemingly irredeemable that the people had long given up struggling against it. There was no light at the end of the tunnel. In such an environment of hopelessness there could be no enterprise, and trade and industry, even agriculture, could barely endure, hardly flourish. The best that the people could hope for was to somehow survive, and that was the limit of their dreams. Its easy to blame everything on 'white colonialism' because thats a narrative that suits the people who are really in power despite the vast improvements your country saw by any metric after the mughals are overthrown besides britain is the ONLY empire in history to VOLUNTERALY give independence to its territories for humanitarian reasons you think the mughals would have shown half the leniency of the british? Ghandi would have been hung from his feet under the mughals again colonialism was a big mistake and should have never have happened but the cartoonish impression people have on these time periods is retarded and helps to further the narrative of the people who are really responsible for essentially enslaving the world under the modern financial system

TBH it's hard to know what to make of them, but 'Racist' doesn't quite fit.   But hey - isn't it great that you were able to stand in a crowd of EDL supporters during a demonstration and, quite literally, openly expose their stupidity on camera, yet no one assaulted you? Author: Furthermathssupport

Text:
@mheners Some of them certainly do. 

But there are two kinds of racist ideas... 

The first kind are complete ideologies that are, actually, kind of complex. Eg: Many senior SS officers actually held Ph.D.'s. 

The second type actual comes from the sad fact that simple, racist ideas are easier to understand than complicated honest ones. It's not that these people set out to be racist, rather they cannot grapple with the complicated reality. FYI: You see this in other groups too, Eg: when militants executed some Egyptian soldiers in Sinai, Corbyn said that he suspected it was secretly Israel. Many people do not have the sense to understand why this was an anti-Semitic statement. 

Ironically, the second group tend to be very polite and respectful when they meet people from the group they normally oppose. Eg: I've actually seen a BNP member (almost) adopt a Pakistani Muslim student. In this case, despite not renouncing the BNP, these two individuals have remained friends for over a decade 

Ultimately, when people struggle to explore ideas - they do not have the sense to realise why the ideas are racist, and they become stubborn when people try to tell them.... but these people also tend to judge all people by what they see. Its easy to demonise a hypothetical Muslim, but much harder to demonise a 'flesh and blood' human being standing in front of you. This, I suspect, is why this guy isnt having any issues in this particular crowd.
Author: Furthermathssupport

Text: @Dan I know what your saying and I agree on most points, but Immigration is not out of control, just go up to parts of Scotland where there is not a sole in sight for many miles. I say we should kick out anyone who like ISIS or lock em up for good. I am not anti Muslim, I just don't like the minority who spoil it for everyone else. It's a bit like dog fouling, most people pick up after their dogs, but it only takes a few to ruin it for EVERYBODY! I know lots of nice Muslims, who are tolerant, peaceful, intelligent and most important of all British!!!! You get Muslims in the police nowadays, I don't care where your from, if your not a bell end then I just don't care. I personally think we should take in MORE refugees, just as long as they aren't going to do bad things. Other countries in Europe need to do their bit too. It's not fair if we have to do it all, but a man in need is a man in need. We are a rich country and I am proud of the fact we send aid to other countries. The UK is a caring country and we should be taking care of people who need our help, whether home or abroad!
Author: Ronald McDonald

Text: Hi, thanks for the video, I don't know if I'm a racist but I think I must be despite having black friends and a black doctor.  What I think I don't like though is the way Britain has changed so much since the 50s.  I have Lithuanian and Polish friends but I don't really like the fact there are so many of them really, our population has gone up so much in the last 20 years from immigration.  And the windrush generation who all seem to have worked hard and absorbed the culture even though people were really rude and racist to them, poor people, the next generation and the generation after that don't look up to the queen so much and british tradition.  I might not be a racist, it might just be change I hate, I think society was better, people were less about their "rights" the whole time.  We have a very selfish materialistic society now.  It's a nastier world out there.  Social change through immigration has to be part of it.  It's weird how the English Defence League though, presumably they're trying to defend people like me, seem so badly educated and wank.  I don't feel very represented by the EDL.  I think it's a shame you didn't join them for good, because you would have brought the tone up a lot.

Text:
@Limited Edition
we are not commenting on the EDL movement, just the video. Im an outsider and i disagree with the comment original as well. Im just as confused, as everyone treated him equally and with respect until they find out he's being satirical. They all accepted him despite him being black, that proves that they were not racist to him. That is a fact that is seen in the video, if anything he's proving them right by editing the video to make them look bad. If anything these chain of comments lead me to believe that you are just mindlessly hating. And don't pretend you know everything cause you live in the UK, cause if you did then you would know brexit was a bad idea. Now whether the EDL movement is racist or not idk, but in this 10 min clip there were no racist acts. Once again, i am commenting on what is happening in the video, as an outside view.

Text: OK, just trying to watch this objectively. At first it is difficult to do that as the title of the video clearly says "UNDERCOVER As A RACIST For 24 HOURS", therefore this would imply that every person shown speaking to Niko is inherently racist (which is a really good tactic for rage baiting views on YouTube). Granted, the only people you did allow to appear on the video, without fast forwarding, were either visibly intoxicated, irrational or Ignorant (EASY to troll). However it does kind of irk me that every time someone, who looked like they wanted to explain their views, was simply skipped over. At 3:50 Lady mentions other group labelling them Nazi's (questionable to know if she is telling the truth but I will give her the benefit of the doubt) , 3:58 says "I'm white, I'm proud, I'm English." Frankly I see no issue with this statement, not to say I agree with her ideology at all. Many people have been indoctrinated to believe that if you are Caucasian you cannot be proud of your heritage and this has become a mainstream narrative which has been pedalled creating pockets of  "White Guilt" in more liberal cities like London, San Francisco. So anyone that is white with conservative views is seen as a fascist/racist (statistically impossible). Man at 5:07 man at says "I'm against Islam as an ideology", this is not really a racist comment. If by this he means fundamentalist Islam, Salafism and Islamism and other extremist sects notwithstanding moderate and liberal Muslims then I think he has a point that is worth discussing. 5:30 not letting us hear what he has to say and just labelling him as racist is irritating because you don't give the viewer the opportunity to decide this for himself from hearing his point of view. Police were quite sensible in this case which was a welcome surprise. Ultimately videos like these are kinda funny but are ultimately subversive in there nature, made to make us subconsciously brand a large number of people as wrong, racist, evil or fascist for having different opinions and points of view.
Author: Mike da gringa

Text: Actually, I have read the Quran, the Hadith, went into Islamic communities, listened to scholars who have studied the Quran and Hadith. If you want historical context we can talk about all of the wars that took place, the merciless killings, the slavery.  We can talk about the Byzantine empire, Arab slave trades.  We can also talk about the laws themselves that derive from the Quran which makes Islam both a religion and political power due to lack of separation of religion and state.  Iran which is one of the most progressive Muslim countries recently threw a young dancer in jail for posting a video of her skills on musically.  The Iranian govt. also whipped her 80 times.  Afghanistan has been going without a reliable power source and the govt. uses force against protesters instead of helping it's citizens.  Muslim feminists groups have been beaten, raped and imprisoned.  A woman was recently assaulted by another Muslim woman because she wasn't wearing a hijab.  Stoning a rape victim is still common.  In Islamic schools in the U.K students are taught to hate the west, Christianity and other religions.  Also, throughout Europe and the U.K Muslim rape gangs are a massive problem.  Countries like Sweden and Germany that have had extremely low crimes now face massive amounts thanks to migration from the Middle East.  It's funny how how you say you're so well traveled yet are so ignorant of the world around.  Also, since Shariah law is....well a law, it's meant to be taken literally and is not open to interpretation like other religions. When you look at the actions of even the political leaders, for example those that burned the U.S flag and shouted "Death to America" after Trump pulled out of the Iranian deal.  That alone show the animosity of Islam. Also, look at the Islamic community in Belgium.  They hid the terrorists who committed the attack in France in Molenbeek. Text:
Jack, there you go with your assumption again.  I don't hate your guts but your selective morals and compassion are all too common in people who refuse to face up to the horrible reality we have today.  Two years ago, I was very like you and made all sorts of excuses for all the heinous things going on.  But we all have to grow up sometime, or kick the problem further down the road until a few years later, it comes back to bite us on the ankle - which it surely will, Jack, believe me.  At this point, Belgian police are simply packing illegals onto boats to make their way to the east coast of the UK.  They are so overwhelmed that they don't bother to uphold the law any more.  I had heard things like this but this had finally made it into a newspaper last weekend.  Explains a lot.  Please don't forget, read the terms and conditions set by the arab nations for us to comply with in the BARCELONA DECLARATION 1995.  No government, including Blair's at the time, has ever had the decency to announce what we are bound to in that document, or to ask our permission.  Sorry for my sarcasm saying "happy reading" because it is anything but.  Thanks for admitting that you 'hate' my 'guts' by the way.  There is the distinction between a leftist/ liberal and a non-leftist/conservative (you call yourself libertarian but those I have met usually have fairer ways of discussing things, and don't often 'hate' like you and most Corbynites and SWP dregs do).  This hatred also plays out in every single leftist protest or 'counter protest'.  A lot of people on whose half you would find yourself demonstrating put black masks and scarves on, hats and basically cover their identity completely and the reason is very often because they intend to be violent and do not want to be found out.  One of them, off Whitehall, London this year, swung a bike lock into a boy's skull.  It was a copycat of what masked American professor, Eric Clanton, had done -  a leftist, of course.  He taught 'ethics and critical thinking'.  Now can you begin to see what I am saying about the contradictory nature of many who kid themselves that their politics is humanitarian, fair, equal?  
Eric Clanton - written article: http://gotnews.com/marxist-public-college-professor-accused-murder-attempts-berkeley-free-speech-rally/

What I think Muslims should have to do before being allowed into the Unitedd States is draw an image of Mohammed. They can draw him however they like. It doesn't have to be a rude drawing. Text: You tell me to do research. Take your own advice. Study Islam and then tell me that Islam isn't a religion of oppression and violence. I actually don't have an issue with people from Muslim countries coming here but I think they should denounce Islam first. There are to many things in Islam that do not fit with western values. Tell me something. Are you OK with killing gay people? Are you OK with punishing your wife because she was raped? Are you OK with the fact that the Quran says that enemies of Islam should die and that the enemies they are talking about are any person who is not muslim? Are you OK with Taqiya (Islam's doctrines of deception)? Are you OK with a religion that is OK with grown men marrying  children? Did you know their profit (Mohammed) had a 6 year old wife? No he did not have sex with her ( at least not until she was 9) but he was allowed to stick his penis in between her thighs and ejaculate. Are you OK with all of these things, or any of them? I am not a racist person. In fact I have black children. I have black, mexican, and Arab friends too. I love people but I can not be OK with a religion that is OK with so many Immoral things. BTW you are the only one in this conversation being rude. You bring no argument and no facts. You just call me rude names. Please calm down and think logical. I haven't been rude to you so there is no need to be rude  to me. All it does is make you look bad and neither of us gain anything from it.

Text: @JLG It's good to end things on a high note. As long as we're both laying out academic references as evidence and not just slandering because i care about the facts than the feelings. Mainstream sources might not always be accepted for whatever reason and again its difficult to find conclusive evidence with regards to the ethnicity of the perpetrators. Many islamaphobes will use the typical stat of 90% but they dont quote sources or data collection of it because they're not intellectually on the level of obedience and objectivity. I shouldn't expect my evidence/data collection to be taken as gospel but as long as we as ponder over it and have a intellectual dialogue  then our differences can be taken as acceptance of ones value of claim. God bless u, sir.
Author: waqas46652

Text: @waqas46652 I do fully understand your point, however, the police force don't record this info on ethnicity and ive spent at the minimum, an hour looking for it. Therefore i must go to the next most legitimate source which i think was CEOP. I have taken the information you provided into account and out of respect read fully through the links provided. However i apologize for that fact that i cant take mainstream media sources to heart especially those politically learning and are not at least centralist. Those being Channel 4, known for being very far left and The Guardian for not being as extreme, but much so. Also i cannot disprove your information provided as a result I feel as if I am in a stalemate. Please respect the fact i cannot accept your reply
Author: JLG

Text:
@JLG According to the Guardian, the numbers by a separate data collection state differently on the ethnicity of the perpetrators. 

‘Available figures are patchy and flawed, but on the face of it they do suggest Asian men are disproportionately involved in group grooming leading to sexual abuse, compared with their numbers in the national population. This impression is supported by several sources in law enforcement who spoke to the Guardian.

‘A 2011 study by the Child Exploitation and Online Protection Centre looked at the 2,379 potential offenders caught grooming girls since 2008. Of 940 suspects whose race could be identified, 26% were Asian, 38% were white and 32% were recorded as unknown. Asians are roughly 7% of the population.

‘A report for the children's commissioner in 2012 found there were 1,514 perpetrators. Of these, 545 were white, 415 were Asian and 244 were black. The ethnicity of 21% of perpetrators was not recorded. Attempts to analyse the Asian figure further runs into problems. Just 35 of the 415 Asians are recorded as having Pakistani heritage and thus highly likely to be Muslim, and only five are recorded as being from a Bangladeshi background. The heritage of 366 of the Asian group is not stated in those figures.’

https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2013/may/14/child-grooming-sexual-abuse-race?CMP=aff_1432&awc=5795_1545592064_ec1c208015e57cf6a24cbcf79949cfad
Author: waqas46652

Text:
@JLG https://fullfact.org/crime/what-do-we-know-about-ethnicity-people-involved-sexual-offences-against-children/ 

The following below is commentary by Full Fact. 

‘Researchers point out that the disproportionate representation of people of Asian ethnicity in studies on grooming gangs may be caused by a number of things including: bias in the collecting of information, the high profile nature of similar cases, and small sample sizes. This might mean, for example, that when recording information about offenders or suspected offenders, the organisations involved are more likely to record ethnicity if the person is Asian. Or it might mean that, because they had seem similar cases in the media, child protection organisations look out for specific types and patterns of grooming and abuse more than others leading to similar types of groups being caught.

‘A large proportion of cases in these studies also have the ethnicity of the offender recorded as unknown, so this could potentially affect the reliability of the information on ethnicities that we do know.’

Other data collection stated by Full Fact, have found a difference with regards to the ethnicity of the perpetrators.

‘In 2011 CEOP published an analysis of possible offenders who had been reported to it for “street grooming and child sexual exploitation”. CEOP said that offenders in these cases often act in groups.

‘It analysed over 1,200 of these possible offenders and found the vast majority were male. Around 30% were white, 28% Asian and 3% black and 38% were unknown. When CEOP looked only at a group of around 940 offenders that it had better information for it found around 38% were white, 32% were unknown, 26% were Asian and 3% were black.’

'It also said that in some cases organisations were more likely to record the ethnicity of a suspect if they were a particular ethnicity or nationality—for example if they were Asian.

'The data it had collected was based on the reports of victims. It found that 36% of perpetrators of child sexual exploitation in gangs or groups were white, 27% Asian, 16% black and 16% not disclosed.'
Author: waqas46652
